Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Complete AST2002 and either (PHY2048 and PHY2048L) or PHY2048C

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary approach to the dynamics of the Solar System through application of Physics, Atmospheric Science, Chemistry and Geology.

AST3114 - Space Weather in the Solar Sys.name: AST3114 - Space Weather in the Solar System

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: How the solar weather forms and solar weather effects on the solar system, including geomagnetic storms, aurorae, and impacts to electronics/GPS systems.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The physics and dynamics of stars, including star formation and stellar evolution.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Descriptive survey of solar system, galaxies and universe; physical properties of stars, H-R diagram, stellar evolution, black holes, neutron stars. Honors level content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: AST 2002, PHY 2048, and Senior standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Experimental design and experimental techniques in astronomy and astrophysics; spherical astronomy; physics of telescopes and of common astronomical detectors; astronomical quantification and interpretation of light.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: AST 2002, PHY 2053C   , and Senior standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Physics of planetary evolution, planetary interiors, and planetary surface processes.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the different types of galaxies, their evolution, their relationship to active galaxies and quasars, and the evolution of the universe.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Asteroids, comets, and meteorites and their role in the origin and evolution of our solar system.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2313, ability to write simple computer programs, and an upper level course in astronomy or planetary science, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Astronomical data formation and acquisition, detector physics, measurement extraction, error analysis, modeling, computer programming, statistics, interpretation, and written and oral presentation of results.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Descriptive survey of solar system, galaxies and universe; physical properties of stars, H-R diagram, stellar evolution, black holes, neutron stars.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Laboratory experiments covering selected topics in astronomy related to AST 2002.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A thought provoking journey through solar system environments and extrasolar planets to establish the probability of life on other planets in our solar system and beyond.
